result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridget M Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Bridget M

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Bridget M Smith in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 14CF708, Court grants the State's motion.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Bridget M Smith in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Application has been submitted to the Drug Treatment Court. Defense requests one more date to see if the defendant has been accepted into the program. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bridget M Smith in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS report addressed. Defense is requesting a plea date 45 days out. Defense will be making an application to Drug Court. Court grants request.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

from Defendant re: WCS monitoring
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Bridget M Smith in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed. Defense updates his clients address. Defense requests one more date in approximately 45 days. Court orders defendant to report to WCS in Milwaukee.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Bridget M Smith did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is currently involved in treatment in Illinois.  The Court addresses the Defendant's non-compliance with WCS.  Hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Treatment letters filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
filed by Attorney Huppertz.
Hearing on February 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program after court today.

Defendant Bridget M Smith in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense presents statements regarding his client's treatment. Defense requests the warrant be quashed and bail set at $1000.00 cash. State requests bail be set at $2500.00 cash. Court orders warrant quashed. Court sets bail at $2500.00 with same conditions as stated in file 14CF708. Complaint addressed - Reading waived. Time limits waived for the Preliminary hearing. Court will give a date in 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
